meanings.definition: A hard protective covering worn on the head, often made of metal or plastic.
meanings.sent1: The football players wore helmets during the game to protect their heads.
meanings.sent2: Construction workers wear helmets to keep themselves safe from falling objects.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut's helmet was so big it looked like a giant bubble on his head.
meanings.sent4: Her helmet of curly hair bounced as she ran, resembling a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent5: The shiny silver helmet gleamed under the bright sun, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To provide or equip with a helmet for protection.
meanings.sent1: The coach helmets each player before they go out to play.
meanings.sent2: Parents helmet their children before they ride their bikes around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The knight decided to helmet his loyal horse for the upcoming jousting tournament.
meanings.sent4: She always helmets her little brother before they go skateboarding together.
meanings.sent5: In the movie, the hero helmets his companions before embarking on their dangerous quest.
